DOC.brief_summary: The aim study evaluate efficacy tolerability , number positive response treatment CAELYX ( 50 mg/m^2 ) , administer monotherapy per 4 week patient metastatic epithelial ovarian cancer , resistant previous platinum therapy .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Evaluate Efficacy Tolerance Caelyx Patients With Epithelial Ovarian Cancer . ( Study P04072 ) ( COMPLETED )
DOC.criteria: Subjects must demonstrate willingness participate study comply procedure sign write informed consent and/or parent legal guardian must sign write informed consent . Women must great equal 18 year age , race . Women childbearing potential ( include woman less 1 year postmenopausal woman become sexually active ) must use acceptable method birth control ( e.g. , hormonal contraceptive , medically prescribe IUD , condom combination spermicide ) surgically sterilize ( e.g. , hysterectomy tubal ligation ) . Morphology ( cytology histology ) confirm diagnosis epithelial ovarian cancer . Patients 1 measurable and/or evaluable tumor , accord result CT , MRT scan Xray , etc . Patients , include primary surgical treatment , previously receive platinum chemotherapy secondline therapy indicate . Karnofsky performance status 60 % . Left ventricular ejection fraction 50 % ( accord result echocardiography ) . Adequate bone marrow function indicate : Platelets > 100x10^9/L Haemoglobin > 9 g/dL Absolute neutrophil count > 1.5x10^9/L Adequate renal function indicate : Serum creatinine < 1.5 х ULN Adequate liver function indicate : Bilirubin level AST ALT activity < 2 х ULN ( exception case related primary disease ) . Women pregnant nursing . Subjects observed designate washout period prohibit medication . Subjects use investigational product within 30 day prior enrollment . Medical history indicate serious concomitant disease , congestive heart failure II NYHA class high , insulindependent diabetes mellitus , clinically significant liver disease , mental disorder . Noncontrolled bacterial , viral fungal infection . Conditions reason ( medical , social psychological ) might prevent adequate followup patient . Any active primary tumor treatment ( except basal squamous cell carcinoma situ cervix carcinoma ) . Patient symptomatic metastasis brain .
